intro: Colubrina cubensis var. ekmanii, commonly known as the Cuban colubrina, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline conditions. It produces small, red or orange fruits that contain seeds dispersed by birds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
